TopicTitle: Are the PPFX and tempgauge memoryleaks one and the same or are they different ones?

Articles.Content: From what sal\_vager said in another thread, it sounds like the PPFX and tempgauge memory leaks are the same, but are they actually the same one or are they different? I heard that there is a memory leak from PPFX, but I thought the temp gauge one was it's own memory leak?

They seem to be different, IME. I was under the impression that it was the PPFX that caused leaky memory, and indeed when I disabled it the out of memory crashes disappeared for my smaller craft. But when I used a larger craft that had more parts that got into critical temperature ranges I started getting crashes again. So now I run with PPFX off and only enable the gauges for a few moments at a time to check temps.

This can't be fixed soon enough, we need some indication of heating problems before parts explode. Hopefully 1.0.3 nips it in the bud.

I recommend the [Critical Temperature Gauge](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/119686) mod to replace the default temperature gauges without leaking memory, and [Temperature Gauge Killer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120731) to keep the default ones off unless requested (F10).
